reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 414/12: TRANSITION: DEEMED ELIGIBILITY FOR ADULT DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES AND SUPPORTS UNDER THE ACT
reg_info.reg_name_text: TRANSITION: DEEMED ELIGIBILITY FOR ADULT DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES and Supports UNDER THE ACT
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 414/12: TRANSITION: DEEMED ELIGIBILITY FOR ADULT DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES AND SUPPORTS UNDER THE ACT
reg_info.act_under: Services and Supports to Promote the Social Inclusion of Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act, 2008

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “eligible person” means a person who falls into one of the classes of persons described in section 2; (“personne admissible”) “Passport Program” means the program that provides services and supports to persons with developmental disabilities funded under section 11 of the Ministry of Community and Social Services Act and section 9 of the Act; (“programme Passeport”) “Special Services at Home Program” means the program funded under section 11 of the Ministry of Community and Social Services Act to provide services for adults with developmental disabilities and under section 7 of the Child and Family Services Act to provide services for children with physical or developmental disabilities, which program was discontinued on March 31, 2012 for persons who are at least 18 years of age. (“Programme de services particuliers à domicile”) O. Reg. 414/12, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“eligible person” means a person who falls into one of the classes of persons described in section 2; (“personne admissible”)

“Passport Program” means the program that provides services and supports to persons with developmental disabilities funded under section 11 of the Ministry of Community and Social Services Act and section 9 of the Act; (“programme Passeport”)

“Special Services at Home Program” means the program funded under section 11 of the Ministry of Community and Social Services Act to provide services for adults with developmental disabilities and under section 7 of the Child and Family Services Act to provide services for children with physical or developmental disabilities, which program was discontinued on March 31, 2012 for persons who are at least 18 years of age. (“Programme de services particuliers à domicile”) O. Reg. 414/12, s. 1.

content.content: 2. This Regulation applies to the following classes of eligible persons:  1. Persons with a developmental disability who are at least 18 years of age and who were receiving or benefiting from services and supports under the Passport Program as of April 1, 2012. 2. Persons with a developmental disability, i. who turn 18 years of age between April 1, 2012 and March 31, 2013, ii. who are receiving or benefiting from services under the Special Services at Home Program immediately before their 18th birthday, and iii. who will receive or benefit from services and supports under the Passport Program as of their 18th birthday. 3. Persons with a developmental disability who are at least 18 years of age before April 1, 2012 and had been found to be eligible for services under the Special Services at Home Program and were placed on a wait list in respect of services provided under that program before April 1, 2012. 4. Persons with a developmental disability, i. who turn 18 years of age between April 1, 2012 and March 31, 2013, ii. who are eligible to receive or benefit from services under the Special Services at Home Program immediately before their 18th birthday, and ii. who are on a wait list in respect of services provided under the Special Services at Home Program before they turned 18 years of age. 5. Persons with a developmental disability who were at least 18 years of age before July 1, 2011 and who were found to be eligible and began to receive or benefit from services under the Developmental Services Act between January 1, 2011 and June 30, 2011. 6. Persons with a developmental disability who were at least 18 years of age before July 1, 2011 and who were found to be eligible to receive or benefit from services under the Developmental Services Act and were placed on a wait list in respect of services provided under that Act between January 1, 2011 and June 30, 2011. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 2.
content.raw_html:
2. This Regulation applies to the following classes of eligible persons:

1. Persons with a developmental disability who are at least 18 years of age and who were receiving or benefiting from services and supports under the Passport Program as of April 1, 2012.

2. Persons with a developmental disability,

i. who turn 18 years of age between April 1, 2012 and March 31, 2013,  

ii. who are receiving or benefiting from services under the Special Services at Home Program immediately before their 18th birthday, and

iii. who will receive or benefit from services and supports under the Passport Program as of their 18th birthday.

3. Persons with a developmental disability who are at least 18 years of age before April 1, 2012 and had been found to be eligible for services under the Special Services at Home Program and were placed on a wait list in respect of services provided under that program before April 1, 2012.

4. Persons with a developmental disability,

i. who turn 18 years of age between April 1, 2012 and March 31, 2013, 

ii. who are eligible to receive or benefit from services under the Special Services at Home Program immediately before their 18th birthday, and

ii. who are on a wait list in respect of services provided under the Special Services at Home Program before they turned 18 years of age.

5. Persons with a developmental disability who were at least 18 years of age before July 1, 2011 and who were found to be eligible and began to receive or benefit from services under the Developmental Services Act between January 1, 2011 and June 30, 2011.

6. Persons with a developmental disability who were at least 18 years of age before July 1, 2011 and who were found to be eligible to receive or benefit from services under the Developmental Services Act and were placed on a wait list in respect of services provided under that Act between January 1, 2011 and June 30, 2011. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 2.

content.content: 3. (1) Subject to subsection (5), eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2,  (a) are deemed to be eligible for services and supports and funding under the Act for purposes of section 14 of the Act; and (b) shall continue to receive, or benefit from, those same services described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5, as the case may be, until such time as an application entity for the geographic area in which the person resides conducts an assessment in accordance with subsection 42 (2) of the Act. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (1). (2) Subsection 42 (2) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (2). Note: Subsection (3) comes into force on the day subsection 42 (3) of the Act comes into force. (3) Subsection 42 (3) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (3). Note: Subsection (4) comes into force on the day subsection 42 (4) of the Act comes into force. (4) Subsection 42 (4) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (4). (5) Eligible persons described in paragraph 2 of section 2 are deemed to satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1) as of the later of January 1, 2013 and their 18th birthday. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (5).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) Subject to subsection (5), eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2,

(a) are deemed to be eligible for services and supports and funding under the Act for purposes of section 14 of the Act; and

(b) shall continue to receive, or benefit from, those same services described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5, as the case may be, until such time as an application entity for the geographic area in which the person resides conducts an assessment in accordance with subsection 42 (2) of the Act. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (1).

(2) Subsection 42 (2) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (2).

Note: Subsection (3) comes into force on the day subsection 42 (3) of the Act comes into force.

(3) Subsection 42 (3) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (3).

Note: Subsection (4) comes into force on the day subsection 42 (4) of the Act comes into force.

(4) Subsection 42 (4) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 1, 2 and 5 of section 2. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (4).

(5) Eligible persons described in paragraph 2 of section 2 are deemed to satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1) as of the later of January 1, 2013 and their 18th birthday. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 3 (5).

content.content: 4. (1) Subject to subsection (5), eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 are deemed to be eligible for services and supports and funding under the Act for the purposes of section 14 of the Act, if the person, (a) has received notice in writing from the person who administers the wait list referred to in paragraph 3, 4 or 6, as the case may be, stating that the person has been found to be eligible for services; or (b) otherwise satisfies an application entity for the geographic region in which the person with a developmental disability resides that the person who administers the wait list referred to in paragraph 3, 4 or 6, as the case may be, has found the person with a developmental disability to be eligible for services. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (1). (2) Subsection 43 (3) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 and who satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (2). Note: Subsection (3) comes into force on the day subsection 43 (4) of the Act comes into force. (3) Subsection 43 (4) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 and who satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (3). Note: Subsection (4) comes into force on the day subsection 43 (5) of the Act comes into force. (4) Subsection 43 (5) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 and who satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (4). (5) Eligible persons described in paragraph 4 of section 2 are deemed to satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1) as of  the later of January 1, 2013 and their 18th birthday. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (5).
content.raw_html:
4. (1) Subject to subsection (5), eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 are deemed to be eligible for services and supports and funding under the Act for the purposes of section 14 of the Act, if the person,

(a) has received notice in writing from the person who administers the wait list referred to in paragraph 3, 4 or 6, as the case may be, stating that the person has been found to be eligible for services; or

(b) otherwise satisfies an application entity for the geographic region in which the person with a developmental disability resides that the person who administers the wait list referred to in paragraph 3, 4 or 6, as the case may be, has found the person with a developmental disability to be eligible for services. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (1).

(2) Subsection 43 (3) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 and who satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (2).

Note: Subsection (3) comes into force on the day subsection 43 (4) of the Act comes into force.

(3) Subsection 43 (4) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 and who satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (3).

Note: Subsection (4) comes into force on the day subsection 43 (5) of the Act comes into force.

(4) Subsection 43 (5) of the Act applies, with necessary modifications, to eligible persons described in paragraphs 3, 4 and 6 of section 2 and who satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (4).

(5) Eligible persons described in paragraph 4 of section 2 are deemed to satisfy the criteria set out in subsection (1) as of  the later of January 1, 2013 and their 18th birthday. O. Reg. 414/12, s. 4 (5).

content.content: 5. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 414/12, s. 5.
